Articles.Content:
<center><h1 style="color: Orange;"><b>EP Industries present</b></h1>

<h2 style="color: Orange;">Mun Station Alpha</h2>

<img src="http://s14.postimage.org/u5kauqzgx/screenshot18.png">

<a href="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/93993128/Mun%20Station%20Alpha.craft">Craftfile</a>

Mun Station Alpha is the first station designed by EP Industries to make sure Kerbals have a permanent base on the Mun.

It provides a place to sleep after digging Mun rocks the whole day and working hard to research new weapon.. uhh i mean rocketry.

During ascent/orbiting and landing the stability of the station is great. (For improved control add some rcs blocks to the craft.)

OOC: This was the first station i have ever build and is part of a larger complex. After standing on the Mun for 1 ingame Kerbal year i wanted to share it with you all.

Only Mechjeb is used. (If needed i could post a craft file without it.)

</center>

Edited August 13, 2012 by Earthpulse

Looks great! I'll send one up when I get home and maybe take some purty screenshots :3

Thanks!

-Nolam
So, how long until the nuclear waste storage explodes violently and hurls the Mun through the Galaxy?
Thanks man, that was the first time I ever landed on the Mun, all thanks to you.

Thanks man, that was the first time I ever landed on the Mun, all thanks to you.

Great to hear that the craft helped you landing on the Mun for the first time. Hope you enjoyed the flight!

I would love to use this, but now I'm on holiday using my iPad, I've landed on both planets with my, um... Well its like I built a vertical space plane and the stuck on a ton of rockets to get it into orbit, but when I try to land its a pain using landing gear? Having this would make it easier plus I have mech jeb

That looks nice, I also have been playing KSP for one year now. But I'm better at landing on the moon (without MechJeb) then building flying moonbases.

You can't really fly without making a rocket.

Thanks for sharing this, I love all these station designs.
